Package nzilbb.ag

Class Anchor

  • Object
    • AbstractMap<K,​V>
      • HashMap<K,​V>
        • LinkedHashMap<String,​Object>
          • TrackedMap
            • Anchor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Comparable<Anchor>, Map<String,​Object>, CloneableBean
    public class Anchor
extends TrackedMap
implements Comparable<Anchor>
    Annotation graph anchor - a node of the graph.
    Author:
    Robert Fromont robert@fromont.net.nz
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Anchor

        public Anchor()
        Default constructor.

      • Anchor

        public Anchor​(String id,
              Double offset)
        Basic constructor.
        Parameters:
        id - The anchor's identifier.
        offset - The anchor's time/character offset.

      • Anchor

        public Anchor​(String id,
              Double offset,
              Integer confidence)
        Constructor with confidence.

        This convenience constructor allows, for example, the creation of an anchor with a confidence value in one step: 

         Anchor anchor = new Anchor("123", 456.789, Constants.CONFIDENCE_AUTOMATIC);
        Parameters:
        id - The anchor's identifier.
        offset - The anchor's time/character offset.
        confidence - Confidence rating.

      • Anchor

        public Anchor​(Anchor other)
        Copy constructor. This copies all attributes of the anchor except id, tracked original values (originalOffset), and attributes whose keys do not begin with an alphanumeric (by convention these are transient attributes), the intention being to create a new anchor that has the same characteristics as other (offset, confidence, etc.), but which is a different anchor with different (initially, no) graph linkages.
        Parameters:
        other - The anchor to copy.

      • Anchor

        public Anchor​(JsonObject json)
        JSON constructor.

        All attributes are copied, including those that are not bean attributes; other are stored as map values.

        Parameters:
        json - JSON representation of the anchor.

        public Set<String> getTrackedAttributes()
        Keys for attributes that are change-tracked - i.e. when a new value is set for any of these attributes, and TrackedMap.getTracker() is set, the change is registered.

        Returns:

      • getOffsetMin

        public Double getOffsetMin()
        Returns the minimum possible offset for this anchor. If the offset is set, the minimum possible offset is the same as getOffset(). Otherwise the annotation graph is traversed to find the anchor with highest preceding offset.
        Returns:
        The minimum possible offset for this anchor, or null if the it can't be determined from the anchor or its graph.

      • getOffsetMax

        public Double getOffsetMax()
        Returns the maximum possible offset for this anchor. If the offset is set, the maximum possible offset is the same as getOffset(). Otherwise the annotation graph is traversed to find the anchor with lowest following offset.
        Returns:
        The maximum possible offset for this anchor, or null if the it can't be determined from the anchor or its graph.

      • getPreceding

        public LinkedHashSet<Anchor> getPreceding()
        Gets all anchors that are linked to this anchor via annotations before this one in the graph.

        This set excludes this anchor and includes instantaneous anchors.

        Returns:
        A set of all anchors that are linked to this anchor and prior to it, ordered by reverse-chain order.

      • follows

        public boolean follows​(Anchor other)
        Determines whether the given anchor is linked to this anchor via annotations before this one in the graph.
        Parameters:
        other - The other anchor.
        Returns:
        True if the other anchor precedes this one in a chain, false otherwise.

      • precedes

        public boolean precedes​(Anchor other)
        Determines whether the given anchor is linked to this anchor via annotations after this one in the graph.
        Parameters:
        other - The other anchor.
        Returns:
        True if the other anchor follows this one in a chain, false otherwise.

      • getFollowing

        public LinkedHashSet<Anchor> getFollowing()
        Gets all anchors that are linked to this anchor via annotations after this one in the graph.

        This set excludes this anchor and includes instantaneous anchors.

        Returns:
        A set of all anchors that are linked to this anchor and following it, ordered by chain order.

      • annotationTo

        public Annotation annotationTo​(Anchor end)
        Finds an annotation for which this is the start anchor and the given anchor is the end anchor.
        Parameters:
        end - The returned annotation's end anchor.
        Returns:
        An annotation for which this is the start anchor and the given anchor is the end anchor, or null if no such annotation exists.

      • annotationTo

        public Annotation annotationTo​(Anchor end,
                               String layerId)
        Finds an annotation for which this is the start anchor and the given anchor is the end anchor, on the given layer
        Parameters:
        end - The returned annotation's end anchor.
        layerId - The returned annotation's layer.
        Returns:
        An annotation for which this is the start anchor and the given anchor is the end anchor, or null if no such annotation exists.

        A string representation of the object.

        A string representation of the object.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo​(Anchor o)
        Compares two anchors. By default, this is by the values of getOffset(). If either anchor has an unset anchor, or their anchors are equal, comparison is by TrackedMap.getId().
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface Comparable<Anchor>
        Parameters:
        o - The other anchor.
        Returns:
        A negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this anchor has an offset that is less than, equal to, or greater than the offset of the specified anchor. If either anchor has an unset anchor, or their anchors are equal, comparison is by TrackedMap.getId().
